bill_title: appropriate funds for increased wages for employees of nursing facilities and to define the distribution from the health care trust fund.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate funds for increased wages for employees of nursing facilities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two million five hundred thousand dollars ($2,500,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Social Services. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated five million dollars ($5,000,000) of federal fund expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Social Services. Section 3. The funds appropriated by this Act shall be used for the exclusive purpose of providing wage increases to employees of nursing facilities, except nursing facility administrators as defined by subdivision 36-28-1(3). Section 4. The secretary of the Department of Social Services shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2003, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate funds for increased wages for employees of nursing facilities and to define the distribution from the health care trust fund. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one million dollars ($1,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Social Services. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated two million dollars ($2,000,000) of federal fund expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Social Services. Section 3. The funds appropriated by this Act shall be used for the exclusive purpose of providing wage increases to employees of nursing facilities, except nursing facility administrators as defined by subdivision 36-28-1(3). Section 4. The secretary of the Department of Social Services shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2003, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. Section 6. On July 1, 2002, or as soon thereafter as funds are available, the state treasurer shall transfer one million dollars ($1,000,000) in earned income from the health care trust fund to the general fund.
